item.title: Animated_wallpaper
item.description: Creating animated wallpapers from .gif or video files There is one thing that I wanted to do for a long time. I was a bit envious of the wallpaper engine from windows. that allows you to run a gif/video in the background as wallpaper. So I have decided to create a script with similar functionality in i3wm. This is how I did it: Prerequisites: xwinwrap animated_background.sh #!/bin/sh [ -z "$1" ] && exit killall xwinwrap sleep 0.

item.title: Hosting hugo on github
item.description: Hugo is a static website generator and github pages are a free way to host webpages Prerequisites: Hugo (https://github.com/gohugoio/hugo) A working hugo website Hosting on github Create two github repositories: One will contain the hugo source files and can be named anything you like. I will name it blog. The second one must be called .github.io and will contain the final files. Clone the them to your computer and put them both into one folder.
